pages.text: The primary use of a pyre is the execution of rituals, and the use of the pyre in this context is described in $(l:rituals/introduction)the rituals introduction$().$(br2)Other uses include the creation of certain herbs, as described in the $(l:herbs/introduction)herbs$()

$(l:herbs/introduction)introduction$(). Further uses include specific types of crafting, which are outlined in later pages, as well as a $(l:crafting/decorative_pyre)decorative variant$().$(br2)$(info) All rituals, including herb crafting and regular item crafting & cooking recipes, can be ended early by pouring a bucket of water upon it. Alternately, a pyre can be broken.$(br2)$(info) Breaking a pyre with items inside it will spill those on the ground.

pages.title: Pyre Crafting
pages.text: Crafting rituals beyond those in the entries for individual $(cat:herbs)herbs$() cannot be listed in full in this guide.$(br2)Additionally, many of these may have been altered or changed or even removed by a modpack.$(br2)$(info) Thankfully, you can see a full listing of these crafting ritual recipes (including herbs) that is up-to-date and relevant to your environment $(uses:roots:pyre)in JEI$().

pages.title: Reinforcement
pages.text: It's possible to reinforce the pyre (which is not resistant to explosions and is weak to Vanilla bosses) with $(l:resources/runed_obsidian)runed obsidian$().$(br2)$(info) This reinforced pyre is immune to bosses and explosions.
